questions: Vegetative propagation is the term given to any asexual means of obtaining new plants. New plants are obtained from the parts of old plants such as stems, roots and leaves, without the help, of any reproductive organ. Some plants growers have developed artificial methods of vegetative propagation such as cutting, layering and grafting which are used in agriculture and horticulture.  Name the method of vegetative propagation in rose and jasmine plant.  “Vegetative propagation produces better plants with higher yield in ornamental crops.” To justify the statement give four reasons.
answers: Grafting in rose & Layering in Jasmine.   It is cheaper, easier and more rapid method of propagation. 		 Better quality of plants can be maintained. ½ 		 Produce seeds with prolonged period of dormancy. 		 Traits or characters of the parent plant are preserved.

questions: Due to heavy rise in demands for tea in international market and simultaneous incentive given by Government on tea plantation, a tea company wants to go for a large scale expansion of its tea plantation in Assam. What are the minimum facilities that the company should provide to its workers ?  What additional step can the company take to motivate the workers to put extra effort for successful expansion of the plantation ?  How can the company arrange fund to implement the project ?
answers: The company must pay the minimum wages prescribed by the Government to its workers. questions: Reproductive health covers in all those aspects of general health which help a person to lead a normal, safe and satisfying reproductive life. answers: STDs are sexually transmitted diseases. Two STDs are — AIDS, Gonorrhea.  Some measures to prevent pregnancy :  Use of intrauterine contraceptive devices.  Use of oral pills.  Use of cervical caps.  Surgical method Tubectomy  Use of vaginal pills.  Use of condoms.

questions: Sexual reproduction is a type of reproduction in which the two sexes, namely, male and female are involved. The male sexual unit is known as male gamete or sperm in humans while female sexual unit is termed as female gamete or ova. Thus, the two major processes, i.e., formation of gametes and fusion of gametes constitute sexual reproduction.  What is fertilisation ?  “Sexual reproduction is considered to be superior to a sexual reproduction in terms of variation in species.” Comment any four points in respect of this statement.
answers: Fusion of a male gamete with a female gamete is known as fertilisation.   It promotes diversity of characters in the offsprings. 		 It results in new combination of genes brought together in gamete. 		 It increases genetic variation. 		 It plays a prominent role in the origin of new species.
